intro: Tripleurospermum heterolepis, commonly known as the white coneflower, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its showy white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has a basal rosette of leaves and produces a tall, branching stem topped with a conical inflorescence. It prefers full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a hardy perennial in USDA zones 4–9. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for gardens and native plant landscapes.
